articles.title: About us
articles.description: Warwick R-user group is for everybody interested in R, the programming language for statistical computing, data science, visualisation and reproducible reporting.
articles.contents:
Warwick R User Group meets every 2 months to discuss R-related topics. At each session, speakers present interesting R packages (and how to make your own), share tips and tricks and offer advice to new R users.
Everyone is welcome, regardless of R programming experience, from across or outside Warwick University. For further information, visit our Meetup.com page or contact a member of the WRUG committee.
Committee



 Carlos Camara Menoyo 




 Aditi Shenvi 




 Chris Mainey 




 James Tripp 




 Heather Turner    



Support

Warwick R User Group is supported by the R Consortium. We follow the R Consortium R Community code of conduct.

            Warwick R-user group is for everybody interested in R, the programming language for statistical computing, data science, visualisation and reproducible reporting.
            Warwick R User Group meets every 2 months to discuss R-related topics. At each session, speakers present interesting R packages (and how to make your own), share tips and tricks and offer advice to new R users.
            Everyone is welcome, regardless of R programming experience, from across or outside Warwick University. For further information, visit our Meetup.com page or contact a member of the WRUG committee.
            Warwick R User Group is supported by the R Consortium. We follow the R Consortium R Community code of conduct.

              Warwick R-user group is for everybody interested in R, the programming language for statistical computing, data science, visualisation and reproducible reporting.
              Warwick R User Group meets every 2 months to discuss R-related topics. At each session, speakers present interesting R packages (and how to make your own), share tips and tricks and offer advice to new R users.
              Everyone is welcome, regardless of R programming experience, from across or outside Warwick University. For further information, visit our Meetup.com page or contact a member of the WRUG committee.
              Warwick R User Group is supported by the R Consortium. We follow the R Consortium R Community code of conduct.
